Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 01:54PM christine52 wrote: Hi Linda  It is very difficult to wait -I believe it is the worst part of the whole discovery that you have breast cancer. I believe you are very lucky to have less than one centimeter lump, if you have to have this dam thing at all. I am sorry you have to go through this merri-go-round of emotion trying to find out what the best treatment is. You are taking the right steps for treatment and remember that contained is a very good thing. Please try and relax and not let the unknown consume you life. I know it is easier said than done but you WILL be ok. Prayers Christine

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 01:04PM christine52 wrote: Hi I had mast with tram (tummy) and developed seroma that was drained many times. Many cc's of fluids were drained off. I do have a little concavity where they aspirated but nothing I can't live with. I can't imagine not having it drained but I guess we are all different. My surgeon didn't seem alarmed by the actually process. It didn't hurt me at all cause I have lost the feeling in the"new " breast. Hope all goes well with you all Christine
